author: bridge-bot
content:
<asn_d6> Hello all.

Right now, when a block contains no blob transactions, we still send an empty sidecar because `blobs_sidecar` is a mandatory field of `SignedBeaconBlockAndBlobsSidecar`.

This behavior trickles all the way down to the KZG library since in this special case the KZG functions will be called with empty lists of blobs/commitments. This is tackled in https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3093 which IMHO impacts some useful invariants in the crypto code (i.e. the invariant that when we are asked to validate a blob, we are also given a blob to validate).

Has it been considered that the `blobs_sidecar` could be optional? And if yes, why has it been discarded as a notion?

Thanks!

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> optional doesn't seem entirely bad. as one of hte validations is to make sure what you receive in the block matches to the sidecar. so you'd quickly see >0 kzg commitments in the beacon block and no sidecar and REJECT
